title: Error installing from source
body_html:
I'm trying to install from source so that I can have #2287 fix. About 72% of the way through, I run into this error

[ 72%] Building NVCC (Device) object caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5/include/avx512fintrin.h(9220): error: argument of type "const void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "const float *"
... (lots more of similar errors from the same header) ...
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5/include/avx512vlintrin.h(11300): error: argument of type "void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "long long *"

92 errors detected in the compilation of "/tmp/tmpxft_00005e64_00000000-6_THCCachingAllocator.cpp1.ii".
CMake Error at caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o.Release.cmake:279 (message):
  Error generating file
  /home/cecilia/pytorch/build/caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/./caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o


caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/build.make:1246: recipe for target 'caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o' failed
make[2]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:2378: recipe for target 'caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:140: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
Failed to run 'bash ../tools/build_pytorch_libs.sh --use-cuda --use-nnpack nccl caffe2 libshm gloo c10d THD'

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2:
    -- I am attempting to install pytorch from source
    -- I have a successful pytorch conda installation in another conda environment
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
    --
export CUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda-8.0/
export CC=/usr/bin/gcc-5
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="$(dirname $(which conda))/../"
python setup.py install
  • OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
  • Python version: Python 3.6.5, Anaconda
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0
  • GPU models and configuration: 2 Quadro P6000
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): gcc-5

Here's the cmake summary

-- General:
--   CMake version         : 3.11.1
--   CMake command         : /home/cecilia/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_source/bin/cmake
--   Git version           : v0.1.11-10223-gf0d3fda06
--   System                : Linux
--   C++ compiler          : /usr/bin/c++
--   C++ compiler version  : 6.4.0
--   BLAS                  : MKL
--   CXX flags             : -msse3 -msse4.1 -msse4.2   --std=c++11  -Wno-deprecated -fvisibility-inlines-hidden -fopenmp -O2 -fPIC -Wno-narrowing -Wall -Wextra -Wno-missing-field-initializers -Wno-type-limits -Wno-array-bounds -Wno-unknown-pragmas -Wno-sign-compare -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-unused-variable -Wno-unused-function -Wno-unused-result -Wno-strict-overflow -Wno-strict-aliasing -Wno-error=deprecated-declarations -Wno-error=pedantic -Wno-error=redundant-decls -Wno-error=old-style-cast -Wno-unused-but-set-variable -Wno-maybe-uninitialized
--   Build type            : Release
--   Compile definitions   : ONNX_NAMESPACE=onnx_torch;USE_GCC_ATOMICS=1;TH_BLAS_MKL;HAVE_MMAP=1;_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64;HAVE_SHM_OPEN=1;HAVE_SHM_UNLINK=1;HAVE_MALLOC_USABLE_SIZE=1
--   CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH     : /home/cecilia/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_source/lib/python3.6/site-packages

--

--     Link local protobuf : ON
--   BUILD_DOCS            : OFF

--   BUILD_TEST            : 0

--     USE_CUDNN           : OFF
--     CUDA version        : 9.0
--     CUDA root directory : /usr/local/cuda-9.0
--     CUDA library        : /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so
--     cudart library      : /usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudart_static.a;-pthread;dl;/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so
--     cublas library      : /usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcublas.so;/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcublas_device.a

    CUDNN_LIB_DIR
body_text:
I'm trying to install from source so that I can have  #2287 fix. About 72% of the way through, I run into this error
[ 72%] Building NVCC (Device) object caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5/include/avx512fintrin.h(9220): error: argument of type "const void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "const float *"
... (lots more of similar errors from the same header) ...
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5/include/avx512vlintrin.h(11300): error: argument of type "void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "long long *"

92 errors detected in the compilation of "/tmp/tmpxft_00005e64_00000000-6_THCCachingAllocator.cpp1.ii".
CMake Error at caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o.Release.cmake:279 (message):
  Error generating file
  /home/cecilia/pytorch/build/caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/./caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o


caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/build.make:1246: recipe for target 'caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o' failed

Failed to run 'bash ../tools/build_pytorch_libs.sh --use-cuda --use-nnpack nccl caffe2 libshm gloo c10d THD'


System Info

-- I have a successful pytorch conda installation in another conda environment

export CC=/usr/bin/gcc-5
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="$(dirname $(which conda))/../"
python setup.py install

GPU models and configuration: 2 Quadro P6000

body:
I'm trying to install from source so that I can have  #2287 fix. About 72% of the way through, I run into this error

```
[ 72%] Building NVCC (Device) object caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5/include/avx512fintrin.h(9220): error: argument of type "const void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "const float *"
... (lots more of similar errors from the same header) ...
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5/include/avx512vlintrin.h(11300): error: argument of type "void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "long long *"

92 errors detected in the compilation of "/tmp/tmpxft_00005e64_00000000-6_THCCachingAllocator.cpp1.ii".
CMake Error at caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o.Release.cmake:279 (message):
  Error generating file
  /home/cecilia/pytorch/build/caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/./caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o


caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/build.make:1246: recipe for target 'caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o' failed
make[2]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/core/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCCachingAllocator.cu.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:2378: recipe for target 'caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:140: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
Failed to run 'bash ../tools/build_pytorch_libs.sh --use-cuda --use-nnpack nccl caffe2 libshm gloo c10d THD'

```

## System Info
- PyTorch or Caffe2:
-- I am attempting to install pytorch from source
-- I have a successful pytorch conda installation in another conda environment
- Build command you used (if compiling from source):
-- 
```
export CUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda-8.0/
export CC=/usr/bin/gcc-5
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="$(dirname $(which conda))/../"
python setup.py install
```
- OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
- Python version: Python 3.6.5, Anaconda
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0 
- GPU models and configuration: 2 Quadro P6000
- GCC version (if compiling from source): gcc-5

Here's the cmake summary

